intro: Allenanthus hondurensis var. parvifolia, commonly known as the Honduran Allenanthus, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. It has a compact growth habit and is often found in the understory of humid lowland habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and understudied species.
